intro: Pleurostachys montana, commonly known as the mountain pleurostachys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. This grass-like plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Pleurostachys montana is often found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
